alert.note: Alert for Clinton (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 8:28PM EST until further notice by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Maple River at Maple Rapids affecting Clinton County. .Rain last week along with snowmelt has caused the Maple River at Maple Rapids to reach minor flood stage. The river is forecast to remain above minor flood stage through at least Saturday. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Maple River at Maple Rapids. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Expect minor flooding of County Line Road and a home along County Line Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM EST Sunday the stage was 9.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 7.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 PM EST Sunday was 9.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.7 feet early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.7 feet on 03/08/1946. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr. The next statement will be issued Monday evening at 1030 PM EST.
